Title: Gold surges, 2026 headwinds, US dollar unwinds: Market Takeaways

Title: Gold blasts past $5,500 to record high on safe-haven demand
Summary:
STORY: Gold extended its record-breaking rally on Thursday, blasting past $5,500 per ounce.

That is as investors sought safety amid geopolitical and economic strains.

The precious metal jumped over 2% by midday in Asia, and is up around 27% just this year. 

Prices broke the $5,000 mark for the first time on Monday and have continued to zoom higher. 

This is driven by a cocktail of factors including strong safe‑haven demand and firm central bank buying. 

Since gold is priced in dollars, the weaker greenback also makes it cheaper for buyers holding other currencies. 

Analysts from OCBC said that "rising government debt burdens, geopolitical concerns and policy unpredictability have accelerated a structural re-rating of gold's role in portfolios."

Silver also notched an all-time high Thursday, coming within a whisker of breaching the $120 mark.

Prices have been helped by demand from investors looking for cheaper alternatives to gold, along with supply shortages and momentum buying.

The white metal has jumped more than 60% so far this year.

Title: Gold Demand to Remain Strong as Investors Reassess Risk, WGC Says
Summary: Lower interest rates, uncertainty in bond markets and persistent geopolitical risks are expected to drive demand this year, the World Gold Council said.

Title: Fresnillo’s Probe Gold Deal Reshapes Portfolio But Valuation Looks Stretched
Summary: Fresnillo (LSE:FRES) has completed its C$770 million acquisition of Probe Gold. The transaction adds Probe Gold’s assets to Fresnillo’s portfolio and closes a previously announced deal. The move expands Fresnillo’s resource base and presence in the precious metals mining sector. Fresnillo, a major precious metals producer, now has Probe Gold’s projects under its umbrella, which could reshape how you think about the company’s mix of assets.
